page.title: 07STH WINGFIELD TRANSPORT
page.content: The only means of public transport in our area is the bus service.This follows a route from Mansfield to Matlock via Alfreton and Crich or Alfreton and Wessington. The bus passes through the area once per hour in each direction. The buses are one-man operated coaches owned by Trent Transport. In our survey we found that buses are used by 10% of people to travel to work and by some to shop in Alfreton. Our railway station closed 18 years ago although the main Sheffield/London line runs through our area. The trains pass through approximately one every two hours in each direction. They are Inter-City 125 expresses.Coal trains also use this line to travel from the pits in North Derbyshire to the power stations of the Trent Valley.
